question.text: The scrotum helps in maintaining the low temperature of the testes

options.text: 4-4.5 <sup>o</sup>C temperature higher than body temperature to facilitate spermatogenesis.
3- 3.5 <sup>o</sup>C temperature higher than body temperature to facilitate spermiogenesis.
2- 2.5 <sup>o</sup>C temperature lower than body temperature to facilitate spermatogenesis.
5-5.5 <sup>o</sup>C temperature lower than body temperature to facilitate spermiogenesis.

solution.text: The testes are situated outside the abdominal cavity within a pouch called the scrotum. The scrotum helps in maintaining the low temperature of the testes (2–2.5<sup>o</sup>C lower than the normal internal body temperature) which is necessary for spermatogenesis.
